channel.title: AVI help
channel.description: Well i downloaded shaun of the dead(torrent) And when i play it i cant see the video... all i can hear is the audio...How do i make it so it shows the video? :confused:

item.title: AVI help
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Download k-lite codec pack, and you shouldn’t have any problems playing any movies with windows media player. I prefer windows media player because it has SRS WOW effects, which is great for movies.

Read full topic

item.title: AVI help
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Mopar1 Mr Mopar
item.description:
@Mr_Mopar1 wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:2, topic:300384”]Download the codec with windows media player.

Or
I would suggest downloading VLC player. http://www.videolan.org/vlc/
It’ll play any video you give it, even flash video. :)[/quote]
it works now ty

Read full topic

item.title: AVI help
item.dc:creator: @djdoyle1 djdoyle1
item.description:
@djdoyle1 wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:4, topic:300384”][quote author=djdoyle1 link=topic=396666.msg2946346#msg2946346 date=1252244536]
Try downloading again with uTorrent (Microtorrent) or BitTorrent
[/quote]

Nonononono. The torrent uploader encoded the video with a codec, that’s why it won’t play with windows media player.
Don’t redownload it and waste your time, just use VLC.[/quote]

yeyeyeyyeyeye. The torrent uploader decoded and THEN encoded it… I think I know I have done 121 (Exacly) videos!

Read full topic

item.title: AVI help
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

djdoyle1:

Try downloading again with uTorrent (Microtorrent) or BitTorrent

Nonononono. The torrent uploader encoded the video with a codec, that’s why it won’t play with windows media player.
Don’t redownload it and waste your time, just use VLC.

Read full topic

item.title: AVI help
item.dc:creator: @djdoyle1 djdoyle1
item.description:
@djdoyle1 wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:2, topic:300384”]Download the codec with windows media player.

Or
I would suggest downloading VLC player. http://www.videolan.org/vlc/
It’ll play any video you give it, even flash video. :)[/quote]

I recomend VLC – DVD’s wont work with Windows Media Player But
Looking at title – AVI – Microsoft Made AVI and WMV – Try downloading again with uTorrent (Microtorrent) or BitTorrent

Read full topic

item.title: AVI help
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Download the codec with windows media player.

Or
I would suggest downloading VLC player. http://www.videolan.org/vlc/
It’ll play any video you give it, even flash video.
